alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 9:26PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until midnight PST. * IMPACTS...Roadway flooding is expected, especially in low-lying and poor drainage areas. In addition, there is the risk of small stream flooding as well as rock and mudslide activity on canyon roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 913 PM PST, radar and rain gauges indicated widespread moderate to heavy rain across the county, and there were many reports of significant roadway flooding. Doppler radar showed a narrow but very intense band of rain with rainfall rates possibly over 1 inch per hour extending from about Atascadero to Avila Beach. This band will sweep through the southern portion of the county through 1030 pm, producing significant roadway flooding, and possibly rock slides and minor mudslides in and below canyons. Rain will begin to taper off ofter midnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Point Piedras Blancas, Cuyama, Grover Beach, Guadalupe, Black Mountain, Santa Margarita, Lake Lopez, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Shandon, Templeton and Oceano. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
